newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore bunkers firm with crude, enquiries thin.
newsitem.headline: Singapore bunkers firm with crude, enquiries thin.

text.p: Singapore bunkers on Friday were firmer but enquiries were thin in an inactive market, brokers said.
"Looking at the cargo market and paper, bunkers are not going to be cheap," said a trader.
Traders said 380 cst bunkers were traded heavily on Thursday at $103 to $105 per tonne. Indications on Friday were $104/$107 for the 380 cst with 180 cst $4-$5 higher at $108/$112.
MDO was assessed at $120 and gas oil at $205, compared to $187/$197 and $203/$205 respectively on Thursday.--Singapore Newsroom (+65 870 3082).
